Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk parted
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: parted bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The parted packages provide tools to create, destroy, resize, move, and copy hard disk partitions. The parted program can be used for creating space for new operating systems, reorganizing disk usage, and copying data to new hard disks. This update fixes the following bug: Previously, the parted utility was not removing the last partition on device-mapper devices, such as mpath. Consequently, some device-mapper devices in the /dev/mapper/ directory were stale. A patch has been applied, and the partition table is now reread when no partitions on device-mapper devices are present. As a result, device-mapper devices are removed as expected. (BZ#1138465) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: Support for the PReP partition GUID (9e1a2d38-c612-4316-aa26-8b49521e5a8b) on GUID Partition Table (GPT) labeled disks has been added to parted. As a result, users can now set the "prep" flag on a partition to enable the PReP GUID when partitioning GPT disks on IBM POWER systems. (BZ#1108196) Users of parted are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
